data.title: Decent food, below average bar service
data.text: I've been here several times over the years and, while I keep coming back when I'm in the area for good food, I always find myself flagging down the bartenders for refills. If I was drinking water, I'd let it slide, but I'm so tired of wanting another beer and I almost have to scream to get their attention. If they would introduce them selves when someone sits down, it would make it easier to yell their name. So, if you're at the bar,  be prepared for below average service.

data.title: Aggie- MSU Game
data.text: Really nice sports bar with a good menus with light items as well. Great setups for groups with pool tables , other activities and numerous televisions. Great for group settings.

data.title: Great Food and Service for the Whole Baseball Team
data.text: This is a spacious restaurant and wasn't too busy on a Saturday evening.  We were able to get seating for 20 adults and 13 kids (baseball team) in the game room.  They were able to put our favorite SEC game on the big screen.  The food was very good and their beer selection is very good and eclectic.  Despite the size of our group, we had plenty of room and our food came out timely.  Wings are good and the nachos are excellent.

data.title: Best service ever!!
data.text: My brother, sister and I met at the Hudson Grille for a leisurely lunch.  Wow!  We were there until three, chatting with each other, the staff and other diners.  It was Monday Burger day.  What a treat!  Huge burgers with your choice of toppings and a side for 40% off regular prices!  We will make Mondays a regular habit.  Great burgers and sides, and the staff is exceptional, starting with the manager who welcomed us at the door and checked on us a couple of times.  Our server, Christina is a gem.  Somehow she kept our order straight even with all the disruptions/conversations from the adjacent booth.  Kudos to her for her patience and extra attention.

data.title: Fun Place
data.text: I have occasional lunch meetings here with local business partners, but this place is even more fun at night.  We come here from work for retirement parties sometimes, and they have pool tables, ping pong, video games, TV's... anything you'd want from a sports bar/restaurant.  The food is goo for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Poor sanitary habits, and slow service
data.text:
The service was disappointingly slow, long wait to get our drinks, some were delivered wrong, and others did not arrive.  I understand we had a large group but the wait was still way too long.  When the waiter delivered the drinks, he grabbed the glasses by the top with his fingers on the drinking surfaces.

Two of our group went into the woman's restroom, and both discovered no toilet paper and the floors were wet in the area of the toilets.

During our stay I noticed one table that was not cleaned off the whole time we were there.

The food was fair, but I was more concerned about the hygiene of the staff.

data.title: Villanova Basketball
data.text:
Large Bar/Grille in Sandy Springs Ga.
Great venue for watching Sporting Events.
This place can handle large crowds and everyone can watch their favorite team- yes this place is that big.
Good menu good selection of foods, and great selection of beers.
Yes they have other drinks if you are not a beer drinker.
Watched Villanova win and ultimately become number one yesterday in Polls.
Next time you want to go watch your team - Go to Hudson Bar/Grille.

data.title: fun place to hang
data.text: great place to go with a group of people, drinks were very good so was food and service.  Great back room with pool tables,  ping pong and shuffleboard.  There is also a bar just outside of room.  Good time, great pretzels with sauces.

data.title: Impressive Food for a Sports Bar
data.text: We don't usually go to sports bars, but the Hudson Grille had such a wide and varying menu that we thought we would give it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised - the atmosphere was calm, the TVs weren't intrusive, and the food was actually rather good and the prices were reasonable.  We'll definitely be back.

data.title: Good food & atmosphere
data.text: Lots of tvs to watch games on. A lot of good looking items on the menu. We ordered the peach bbq ribs which were delicious & fall off the bone tender. With mac and cheese which was also delicious and French fries that were ok I guess. It did take them 3 times to get one of our party's order right. But other than that good & friendly.

data.title: Top to bottom fantastic
data.text: My friends and I stopped in for a farewell dinner and it was lovely. It's not a "cozy" environment like Olive Garden or anything like that. We didn't have to worry about being too loud or making other patrons uncomfortable. Our waitress was pristine! She was efficient with orders, delivery and any issues that arose. One of my group did not like the way her drink was made and the waitress was on the ball to suggest another that she ended up enjoying so much better. The food was great too. I wish I could have been able to eat more! We'll definitely be back for another visit.

data.title: Pretty good sports bar
data.text: The menu has a lot of variety. Crispy chicken sandwich, spinach dip, and blue cheese chips were delicious. The harvest salad is also very good. It's loud in certain parts of the place but the staff was very accommodating and moved us to a quieter spot.

data.title: Fun place to watch College Football!
data.text: There to watch the Ohio State Buckeyes v Michigan Wolverines. We had the best waiter, Hakim. He was fantastic. Usually with a crowd that big, the waiters/waitresses are so busy that you have to wait for drinks & food. Not with Hakim. He was attentive & prompt. Best waiter we have ever had at a sports bar! Food is very good. Huge selection of beers and drinks. Televisions everywhere. Not a bad seat in the house. We had a great time. This is the 2nd year we have been to this gamewatch and will continue to attend coming to Atlanta for this weekend.

data.title: My New FAVORITE Restaurant!
data.text:
I must concede, this was the best eating out experience i've had all year! What made it so great is the warm & genuine family friendly environment, the pleasant and obviously happy employees,  the phenomenal food (I ordered a house salad w balsamic dressing & Luau Sirloin w stemmed broccoli and jasmine rice. I highly recommend this! Others found joy in the legendary New York Reubens sandwich), and the occasion accommodating space itself. This place is great for birthday parties,  receptions, date &/or family night! They have 3 nicely sized private rooms--my meeting was on one of them, then there is still the rest of the restaurant & patio area! Adam, who was one of our servers, was quick and efficient.  Sam--my direct server was one hard working woman! I loved that she repeated our order back to us to make sure we were receiving our request. When you walk in this place, you are graced by --Shelby the hostess--who represents the restaurant very well & Latoya--who went above and beyond for me once my meeting was over by bringing me hot tea w lemon and honey since I was waiting for someone to join me.
Austin--was amazing! It was his first day at work--he fit right in the warm family friendly environment. Finally, Liz, the manager on duty ran a tight ship PLUS a well oiled machine!--Please forgive me if I forgot anyone!!!In fact, STOP WHAT YOU ARE DOING AND GO TO HUDSON GRILLE!

data.title: A Happening Sports Bar and Restaurant
data.text: Hudson Grille is a great place to eat if you love sports.  They have televisions everywhere.  Sometimes, it can get kind of noisy but it is a sports bar.  There are also some really great special deals during the week.  The food is typical American fare but it is always good.  There is plenty for a vegetarian to choose from.

data.title: Good burger
data.text: Had lunch today - first visit. Friendly staff. Enjoyed Monday special on burgers. Good burger and good price. Also ordered onion rings. Was told they were really good but I was a little disappointed. They were average at best.  All in all a good value and I will be back.

data.title: Great food and service.
data.text: We had a party of 12, 5 children, 7 adults and ordered a variety of items on the menu.  I had the grilled chicken with rice, spinach and tomatoes on our waiter's recommendation and it was tasty and more than I could eat.  My husband had the fall off the bone ribs, also very good.  Everyone enjoyed their dinner.  Following dinner, the entire party enjoyed the game room.  The service was impeccable.

data.title: Disappointing restaurant
data.text: They have a great sounding menu.  Unfortunately it does not live up to its promise.  Went for brunch the first time, and was satisfied with what we got.  Went back for dinner since the menu looked so good.  Unfortunately, the food did not live up to its promise.  Greasy, overspiced, and generally disappointing.

data.title: Not The Place for Dinner Meeting
data.text:
I went to a dinner meeting last night sponsored by a drug company for patients and family of those with Multiple Sclerosis.  This was NOT a place that such a dinner should be.

While it started off nice with someone taking our drink orders, the room of @100 people was left with one server!  It took nearly an hour to get everyone served their salad.  Then people were served by what they ordered leaving at our table, one person with food and two waiting endlessly.

When someone dropped a utensil on the floor, as people with MS have a tendency to do, I watched the wait staff see in, and step over it twice.  THIS multiple sclerosis patient got up and picked it up to prevent any body from accidentally tripping and getting hurt.  NO EXCUSE!

Food, we had four choices: salmon, steak and shrimp, BBQ ribs and Chicken.  The steak was fatty and small, chicken was over cooked and dry, only the ribs was enjoyable by someone at our table.  Since there was only one server, it took 40 minutes by the time someone at our table got the soda they asked for.

This restaurant got the opportunity to have repeat business, but blew it.  They were only interested in profit, but did not provide adequate staff (wait staff and chef) to accommodate this dinner.

data.title: Great Sports bar, good food and awesome bartender
data.text:
So I went here cuz it was the only place open late in Sandy Springs.  They serve drinks AND food late.  It is a classic sports bar done well and done HUGE!  All kinds of pool tables, shuffle board, ping pong etc and tons of good quality tvs.  Believe it or not the food was actually way better than expected too.  The highlight though was my bartender. Roxy was her name.  She was friendly, attentive, helpful and cute.  Very cute.  That always helps.

In summary you can go here late, east well, play games and drink with a cute girl.  What more can you ask for?  DO IT!
